channel.title: Psalms on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in Psalms on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: Psalms 1
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 1

1 People are blessed that don’t take advice from the wicked or stand among sinners or sit with scoffers,

2 but delight in the Law of Yahveh and meditate on it day and night.

3 They’re like trees planted beside a river that bear fruit in season, whose leaves don’t wither. They’re successful at what they do.

4 Sinners aren’t like that: they’re like chaff that wind blows away;

item.title: Psalms 2
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 2

1 Why do the nations get together to plot pointless schemes?

2 Kings take their stand and rulers hold counsel against Yahveh and his Anointed One [Messiah]:

3 Let’s break their bonds and throw them away."

4 The One that’s in heaven laughs; Yahveh scoffs at them.

5 He’ll speak to them in his anger and terrify them with his fury:

6 I’ve installed my King on Zion, my holy mountain."

item.title: Psalms 3
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 3

1 Yahveh, I have so many enemies; so many are working against me;

2 so many are saying, “God’s not going to help him."

3 But you’re my shield, Yahveh, my glory, the One that holds my head up.

4 When I call out to you, you answer from your holy mountain.

5 I lie down to sleep and wake up again because you sustain me.

6 I won’t be afraid if 10,000 oppose me.

item.title: Psalms 4
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 4

1 Righteous God, answer when I call! Take time for me in my distress; listen graciously to my prayer.

2 People, how long will you try to ruin my reputation? How long will you love unfounded accusations and outright lies?

3 Just remember that Yahveh sets good people apart for himself; he’ll listen when I call out to him.

4 If you’re angry, don’t sin; just think it to yourself in bed; don’t act it out.

item.title: Psalms 5
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 5

1 Listen to me, Yahveh; Pay attention to my groaning.

2 Hear my call for help, my God and King, because I pray only to you.

3 You hear me in the mornings, when I offer my prayers and wait.

4 You’re not amused by sinfulness because there’s nothing bad about you.

5 Braggards can’t stand in your presence because you send away everyone that sins.

6 You destroy liars and abhor bloodthirsty people.

item.title: Psalms 6
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 6

1 Don’t lash out at me, Yahveh, or take me to task in your anger.

2 Be gracious to me because I’m weak; heal me because I’m troubled deep inside.

3 I’m really scared; how long, Yahveh, before you save me?

4 Come back and rescue me; because of your enduring love, save me;

5 because nobody talks about you when they’re dead; who gives you gratitude in Sheol?

item.title: Psalms 7
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 7

1 Yahveh my God, I’ve taken refuge in you; protect me from persecutors

2 so they won’t tear me apart like a lion does, and drag me away with no one to rescue me.

3 Yahveh my God, if I’ve done wrong, if there’s any injustice in me,

4 if I’ve betrayed a friend or plundered an adversary for no reason,

5 chase me down and slay me; trample me on the ground, lay my honor in the dust.

item.title: Psalms 8
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 8

1 Yahveh, our Lord, you’re so majestic all over the world! You display your splendor higher than the sky!

2 Out of the mouth of infants and nursing babies you’ve established a defensive wall against your adversaries, to silence enemies that want revenge.

3 When I look at the sky, the work of your fingers, the moon and stars you’ve set in place,

4 what are we that you give us any thought or care about us?

item.title: Psalms 9
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 9

1 I’ll thank you, Yahveh, with all my heart and call attention to the amazing things you’ve done.

2 I’ll gladly celebrate over you and sing your praise, Most High.

3 When my enemies retreated, they staggered and died in front of you

4 because you judged in my favor; you sat on your throne and judged justly.

5 You’ve rebuked the nations, destroyed the wicked, and blotted out their names forever.

item.title: Psalms 10
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 10

1 Why stand so far away, Yahveh? Why hide when trouble comes?

2 Sinners hunt down the poor in arrogance and get themselves caught in their own schemes.

3 They brag about their sinful desires; they bless the greedy and curse Yahveh.

4 In their arrogance, they don’t trust in him; they just keep acting like there’s no God.

5 Yet they always seem to prosper; they don’t see your coming judgments from on high; they sneer at adversaries

item.title: Psalms 11
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 11

1 I rely on Yahveh’s protection; so why tell me, “Flee like a bird to the mountains

2 because the ungodly are bending the bow; they’re putting their arrow to the string to shoot from the shadows at the godly in heart.

3 If the foundations of society collapse, what can good people do?"

4 Yahveh is in his holy Temple; he rules from heaven, watching everyone, examining each one.

item.title: Psalms 12
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 12

1 Help, Yahveh; there aren’t any decent people left; the faithful are disappearing.

2 Neighbors lie to one another and speak with flattering lips and deceitful hearts.

3 May Yahveh cut off their flattering lips and bragging tongues 4that say “We can talk our way out of anything; they’re our lips; who’s going to stop us?"

5 Yahveh says, “Since the oppressed are suffering violence and the needy groan, I’ll come to give them the protection they long for."

item.title: Psalms 13
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 13

1 Yahveh, are you going to forget about me forever? How long will you ignore me?

2 How long must I counsel myself in constant sorrow? How long will my enemies lord it over me?

3 Think about me and respond to me, Yahveh my God; brighten my eyes so they don’t grow dull as in death,

4 so my enemies won’t brag about defeating me and celebrate over my downfall.

item.title: Psalms 14
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 14

1 Fools keep telling themselves there’s no God, corrupt people that do corrupt things; none of them does what’s right.

2 Yahveh looks down from heaven to see if there’s anybody that lives wisely, if anybody seeks him.

3 But they’ve all veered off course and become corrupted; not a one of them does what’s right, not a one.

4 Don’t sinners realize what they’re doing when they eat up my people like bread and refuse to call on me?

item.title: Psalms 15
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 15

1 Yahveh, who can live in your Tabernacle? Who can reside on your holy hill?

2 Those who act with integrity, who do what’s right and tell the truth;

3 who don’t mistreat their neighbors or join in gossiping about their friends;

4 who despise reprobates, but honor people that respect Yahveh, who even swear to their own disadvantage and carry it through,

5 that don’t charge interest or accept bribes against innocent people. People like that will always be secure.

item.title: Psalms 16
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 16

1 Protect me, Yahveh; you’re my refuge.

2 I say, “You’re my Lord; apart from you, I don’t have anything good."

3 The godly people on earth are the noble ones I delight in.

4 Trouble multiplies for those who rush off to some other god; I won’t pour out blood offerings with them or even say their names.

5 Yahveh is my permanent possession, my cup; he holds in safekeeping what’s allotted to me.

item.title: Psalms 17
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 17

1 Yahveh, listen to my call for justice; pay attention to my sincere prayer.

2 Declare me innocent because you see that I’m righteous.

3 You’ve visited me at night and tested my heart; you’ve put me on trial and found nothing wrong; I’m determined not to say anything sinful.

4 Your word has kept me from following the example of cruel people.

5 My steps have stayed on your path; my feet haven’t slipped.

item.title: Psalms 18
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 18

1 I love you, Yahveh, my strength;

2 my fortress, my deliverer, my God, my Rock, my Refuge; my shield, the place that saves me, my stronghold."

3 I called on him who deserves praise, and he saved me from my enemies.

4 The waves of death entangled me; the torrents of destruction flooded over me.

5 the cords of Sheol tied me down; the snares of death had entrapped me.

item.title: Psalms 19
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 19

1 The heavens show God’s glory; the sky displays his workmanship.

2 Day in and day out they speak; night after night they display intelligence.

3 There’s no speech or words; there’s nothing to hear.

4 Their testimony goes out to the whole world, their message to the ends of the earth; in them he’s pitched a tent for the sun.

5 It’s like a groom coming out of his room, excited like a man in shape to run a race.

item.title: Psalms 20
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 20

1 When trouble comes, may Yahveh answer you! May Jacob’s God set you safely on high!

2 May he send help from the sanctuary and support you from Zion!

3 May he remember your many meal offerings and find your burnt offerings acceptable.

4 May he grant you your heart’s desire and make your plans successful.

5 You’ll sing for joy over his deliverance and hoist your banners in his name. May Yahveh give you your petitions.

item.title: Psalms 21
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 21

1 Yahveh, the king delights in your strength; he’s happy because you’ve helped him.

2 You’ve given him his heart’s desire; you didn’t withhold his request.

3 You met him with blessings and crowned him with fine gold.

4 He asked you for life, and you gave him life everlasting.

5 He has great honor because you delivered him and endowed him with splendor and majesty.

6 You make him blessed forever and happy because you’re with him.

item.title: Psalms 22
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 22

1 My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from helping me, so far from my groaning?

2 I call out in the daytime, but you don’t answer; I don’t get any relief at night.

3 Yet you’re holy, enthroned on Israel’s praises.

4 Our ancestors trusted in you, and you delivered them.

5 They called out to you, and you saved them; they relied on you, and you didn’t disappoint them.

item.title: Psalms 23
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 23

1 Yahveh is my shepherd; I’ll have everything I need.

2 He beds me down in green pasture and leads me beside still water.

3 He refreshes me and guides me along good paths for his honor.

4 Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I won’t be afraid, because he’s with me; his rod and staff reassure me.

5 You set a table for me in front of my enemies; you anoint my head with oil; my cup runs over.

item.title: Psalms 24
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 24

1 The earth and everything in it belongs to Yahveh, the world and those who live here.

2 He positioned land higher than seas, more elevated than ocean currents.

3 Who can climb his mountain and stand in his holy place?

4 People with clean hands and pure hearts, who don’t offer themselves up to idols or lie under oath.

5 They’ll receive a blessing from Yahveh, goodness from the God who keeps them safe.

item.title: Psalms 25
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 25

1 I hold my life up to you, Yahveh;

2 I trust you; don’t let me down or let my enemies celebrate over my defeat.

3 Nobody that waits for you will be discredited; people who deal treacherously are the ones that will be discredited.

4 Yahveh, let me know your ways; teach me your paths;

5 lead me in your truth because you keep me safe; I’ll always depend on you.

item.title: Psalms 26
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 26

1 Declare me innocent, Yahveh, because I’ve conducted myself with integrity and trusted in you without wavering.

2 Examine me, put me on trial, test my motives and attitude.

3 I keep my eye on your unfailing love and follow you faithfully.

4 I don’t sit with deceitful people or run around with pretenders.

5 I detest the company of unreliable people and refuse to join in with sinners.

item.title: Psalms 27
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 27

1 Yahveh is my light and salvation; who am I going to be afraid of? He defends me; who am I going to dread?

2 When bad people come to devour me, they stumble and fall.

3 Though an army attacks me, it won’t frighten me; though war breaks out against me, I’ll stay confident.

4 I ask Yahveh for one thingâ€”what I look for most: to live in his house my whole life, to see his beauty and meditate in his Temple.

item.title: Psalms 28
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 28

1 I’m calling out to you, Yahveh; don’t turn a deaf ear, my Rock; otherwise, I’ll be like someone going down to the Pit.

2 Help me when I plead for help, when I lift up my hands toward your holy sanctuary.

3 Don’t drag me away with the wicked, with those who sin, who offer their neighbors peace while selfish motives lurk in their hearts.

4 Pay them back according to their deeds, in proportion to the sin they practice.

item.title: Psalms 29
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 29

1 Children of the mighty, attribute to Yahveh honor and strength.

2 Honor him like he deserves; worship him in his holy splendor.

3 The sound from Yahveh carries out over the water; our glorious God thunders across the ocean expanse.

4 His voice is loud and majestic

5 and blows down cedars in Lebanon.

6 He makes Lebanon skip like a calf and Sirion [Mt. Hermon] jump around like a young wild ox.

item.title: Psalms 30
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 30

1 I’ll praise you, Yahveh, because you’ve rescued me; you haven’t let my enemies celebrate victory over me.

2 I appealed to you for help, my God, and you restored my health;

3 you brought me up from Sheol; you kept me from going down to the Pit.

4 Sing praise to Yahveh, his holy people; thank him 5because his anger is only for a little while, but his blessing lasts a lifetime. Weeping may go on all night, but rejoicing comes in the morning.

item.title: Psalms 31
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 31

1 I take refuge in you, Yahveh; never let me be disgraced; in your goodness protect me.

2 Listen to me, rescue me quickly; be a rock for me, a strong fortress to save me.

3 You’re my rock and fortress; for your honor, lead me and guide me.

4 Free me out of the trap people secretly laid for me because you’re my protection.

5 I’m entrusting my spirit to you; rescue me, Yahveh, true God.

item.title: Psalms 32
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 32

1 How blessed they are whose sin God forgives, whose transgression he covers;

2 whose disobedience Yahveh doesn’t hold against them, whose spirit doesn’t harbor deceit!

3 When I didn’t acknowledge my sin, my body wasted away, I moaned all day,

4 your hand weighed on me day and night, my strength drained away in the summer heat.

5 When I acknowledged it and said, “I’ll confess my sin to Yahveh,” you forgave me.

item.title: Psalms 33
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 33

1 Sing for joy to Yahveh, good people; praise is fitting for the godly.

2 Give himY thanks with a lyre; sing praises to him with a ten-string harp.

3 Sing a new song to him; play skillfully and shout for joy.

4 You can believe what heY says and rely on what he does.

5 He loves goodness and justice, and fills the world with his enduring love.

item.title: Psalms 34
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 34

1 I’ll bless Yahveh at all times and praise him constantly.

2 I’ll make my boast about him; the helpless will hear it and take heart.

3 Let’s tell how great Yahveh is; let’s honor him together.

4 I looked to Yahveh; he answered me and freed me from my fears.

5 People that look to him are radiant; they never look subdued.

6 I cried out in my suffering, and heY listened and saved me from my troubles.

item.title: Psalms 35
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 35

1 Yahveh, oppose the ones that oppose me; fight those who fight me.

2 Put on buckler and shield, and come to my aid.

3 Draw spear and javelin against my pursuers; tell me you’ll save me.

4 Dishonor the ones that want to kill me; drive back and humiliate those who scheme against me.

5 Make them like chaff in the wind, with the angel of Yahveh blowing them.

item.title: Psalms 36
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 36

1 Sin speaks to sinful people’s hearts; they don’t respect God at all.

2 They flatter themselves that he can’t discover their sin.

3 Their words deceive; they’ve stopped being wise and doing good.

4 They devise schemes in bed and carry them out in the morning with no qualms

5 Yahveh, your enduring love reaches the stars; your faithfulness is as high as the sky;

6 your goodness as mighty as the mountains; your justice as deep as the ocean; your provision sufficient for everything that breathes.

item.title: Psalms 37
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 37

1 Don’t worry about bad people or envy those who do wrong;

2 they’ll wither like grass and fade like flowers.

3 Trust in Yahveh and do good so you can live in the land and enjoy security.

4 Delight in Yahveh, and he’ll give you what your heart desires.

5 Commit your way to him and trust in him, and he’ll act on your behalf.

6 He’ll bring forth your goodness like the dawn and your vindication like the midday sun.

item.title: Psalms 38
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 38

1 Yahveh, don’t rebuke me in your wrath or discipline me in your furious anger.

2 Your arrows have pierced deep into me; your hand has come down hard on me.

3 Because of your indignation, my body’s not sound; by my sin I’ve ruined my health.

4 My iniquities have piled up higher than my head and weighed me down.

5 My wounds have festered and grown foul. My foolish choices 6have doubled me over; I grieve all the time;

item.title: Psalms 39
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 39

1 I said, “I’ll watch what I do so I won’t sin with my tongue; I’ll put a muzzle on my mouth while sinful people come around."

2 But when I kept silent even about what was good, it was of no avail; my agitation grew worse.

3 The more I thought about it the more the fire burned within me; so I spoke up:

4 Yahveh, show me my end, how long I’ll live; let me realize how fleeting my life is.

item.title: Psalms 40
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 40

1 I waited patiently for Yahveh; he listened to my call for help.

2 He brought me up out of the pit of despair, out of the muddy clay, set my feet on solid rock, and made my footsteps secure.

3 He put a new song in me, a song about praising God; other people will hear it, see what he’s done, and trust in himY.

4 How blessed people are that trust in Yahveh instead of turning to proud or deceitful people.

item.title: Psalms 41
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 41

1 How blessed people are that have regard for the poor; Yahveh will deliver them when they have need.

2 He’llY protect them, keep them alive, and call them blessed;

3 sustainY them when they’re sick and restore them to health.

4 I said, “Be gracious to me, Yahveh; heal my soul because I’ve sinned against you."

5 My enemies say rude things about me: “When’s he going to die so we can forget about him?"

item.title: Psalms 42
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 42

1 My soul pants for God like a deer pants for water.

2 My soul is thirsty for the living God; when will I ever see him?

3 My tears have been my food day and night as people ask me all the time, “Where’s your God?"

4 I think about these things as I pour out my soul. I used to go with the throng, leading the procession to the house of God, singing for joy and giving thanks in the great celebration.

item.title: Psalms 43
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 43

1 Declare me innocent, God; defend me against this ungodly nation; deliver me from liars!

2 You’re the God that I rely on for courage; why reject me? Why do I go around mourning because my enemies oppress me?

3 Send your light and truth to lead me, to bring me to the holy hill where you live.

4 Then I can go to your altar, my greatest source of joy, and praise you with a harp.

item.title: Psalms 44
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 44

1 God, our ancestors have told us what you did in their time long ago.

2 You drove out nations and planted this one; you struck them and scattered them abroad.

3 Our ancestors didn’t conquer the land with their sword; their own arm didn’t save them. Your right hand, your arm, the light of your presence did it when you showed them favor.

4 You’re my King, God; ordain victories for Jacob in our day too.

item.title: Psalms 45
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 45

1 My heart is overflowing with a noble theme as I recite my verses to the King; my tongue is like the pen of a gifted poet.

2 You’re more handsome than the sons of men; gracious words stream from on your lips; God has blessed you forever.

3 Strap your sword to your thigh, Mighty Warrior, in your splendor and majesty!

4 In your majesty, ride on to victory, defending truth, humility, and goodness; have your right hand display awesome deeds.

item.title: Psalms 46
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 46

1 God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help when trouble comes.

2 So we won’t be afraid though the ground tremors, though the mountains cascade into the sea,

3 though its water roars and foams, though the land quakes at its tsunamis.

4 There’s a river of joy that flows into the city of God, the sacred place where the Most High lives.

5 God is there; it’s unmovable; from the break of day, he protects it.

item.title: Psalms 47
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 47

1 Clap your hands, everybody; shout to God with joy;

2 because you are to revere Yahveh Most High, the great King over the whole world.

3 He subdued people groups under us, put nations beneath our feet,

4 and chose our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob that he loves.

5 God has ascended with a shout, with a trumpet fanfare.

6 Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises;

item.title: Psalms 48
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 48

1 Yahveh is great and deserves great praise in the city of our God on his holy mountain.

2 Mount Zion, the heights of Zaphon, is high and beautifulâ€” the joy of the whole earth, the city of the great King.

3 In its towers God reveals himself as a strong defense.

4 Kings joined forces and advanced against that strong defense.

5 But as soon as it came into view, they panicked and fled.

item.title: Psalms 49
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 49

1 Hear this, every nation; listen, everyone on earth,

2 low and high, rich and poor alike.

3 My words are wise; my thoughts are full of insight.

4 I listen to proverbs and expound my riddles on a harp.

5 Why should I be afraid when there’s adversity, when my enemies’ sins are all around me,

6 people who trust in their wealth and brag about how rich they are?

item.title: Psalms 50
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 50

1 The Mighty One, God, Yahveh, has spoken and calls to earth from sunrise to sunset.

2 He shines forth out of Zion in perfect beauty.

3 Our God comes; he doesn’t stay quiet; a fire consumes in front of him; a storm rages around him.

4 He calls on the sky above and the earth beneath to witness the judgment of his people.

5 Gather my people to me that I’ve made a covenant with by sacrifice."

item.title: Psalms 51
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 51

1 Be gracious to me, God, in proportion to your enduring love; according to your great mercy, blot out my transgressions.

2 Wash me thoroughly from my sin; cleanse me from my iniquity.

3 I know my failings; my sin always weighs on my mind.

4 I’ve sinned against you and you only; I did what you consider evil; so you’re justified in what you say to me, blameless when you condemn me.

item.title: Psalms 52
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 52

1 God’s enduring love lasts all day; so why brag about sinning, great soldier?

2 Your tongue cuts like a razor.

3 You like evil more than good, falsehood more than truth.

4 You like words that devour and a lying tongue that deceives.

5 But God will strike you down once and for all; he’ll pull you out of your tent and uproot you from the land of the living.

item.title: Psalms 53
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 53

1 Fools tell themselves there’s no God. They’re corrupt and commit disgusting sins; none of them does what’s good.

2 God looks down from heaven to see if anybody understands, if anybody looks to him.

3 Every one of them has turned aside and become corrupt; not a one does what’s good, not a one.

4 Won’t sinners ever learn? They eat up my people like bread and don’t pray to me.

item.title: Psalms 54
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 54

1 Deliver me, God, by your name; vindicate me by your power.

2 Listen to my prayer; hear what I have to say.

3 Foreigners have attacked me; violent people have tried to kill me; they don’t care about you.

4 But God helps me; Yahveh sustains my life.

5 He pays back my adversaries and destroys them in his faithfulness.

6 I’ll sacrifice to him willingly and thank him because he’s good.

item.title: Psalms 55
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 55

1 Hear my prayer, God; don’t ignore my plea.

2 Listen and answer; trouble has overwhelmed me; I’m distracted

3 by the threats of my enemies, by bringing suffering on me and bearing angry grudges against me.

4 My heart’s pounding; terror of death has fallen on me.

5 Fear and trembling have come over me; horror has overwhelmed me.

6 I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove! I’d fly off and find peace.

item.title: Psalms 56
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 56

1 Be gracious, God; people are walking all over me, oppressing me all the time, 2attacking me.

3 When I’m afraid, I put my trust in you.

4 In you, whose word I praise, I’ve put my trust; what can mortals do to me?

5 All day long they try to frustrate my purposes; they think up ways to harm me.

6 They stir up conflict, they lurk, they watch my every step, looking for a chance to kill me.

item.title: Psalms 57
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 57

1 Be gracious to me, God, because I depend on you to protect me; in the shadow of your wings I take refuge till danger passes.

2 I call out to God Most High, who accomplishes everything for me;

3 he sends help from heaven to rescue me and discredits whoever tries to run over me.

4 I live among lions; I have to lie among those who breathe fire, people whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.

item.title: Psalms 58
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 58

1 Leaders, do you decree what’s right? Do you judge justly?

2 No, you plot injustice in your hearts and spread violence in the land.

3 The sinful go astray from the womb; they lie from the time they’re born.

4 They have venom like vipers, and stop up their ears like deaf cobras

5 so they don’t hear their charmers’ voices or those skilled at casting spells.

item.title: Psalms 59
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 59

1 Deliver me from my enemies, God; set me on high away from my attackers.

2 Save me from sinners; rescue me from bloodthirsty people.

3 They lie in ambush to kill me; fierce enemies stir up conflict against me, Yahveh, but not for my transgression.

4 For no fault of mine, they run to attack me; get up to see and help me!

5 Yahveh God of Hosts, God of Israel, wake up and punish the nations; don’t extend grace to any that are treacherous.

item.title: Psalms 60
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 60

1 You’ve rejected us, God, and broken us; you’ve been angry, but restore us now.

2 You’ve made the land quake; you’ve split it open; now repair the faults and stop the tremors.

3 You’ve made your people endure hardship and given us wine that makes us stagger.

4 You’ve raised a banner for those who respect you as a rallying point for truth.

5 Save us now with your right hand and answer us, deliver your beloved.

item.title: Psalms 61
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 61

1 Listen to my prayer, God; hear my prayer.

2 With a faint heart I call to you from the end of the earth; lead me to the rock that’s higher than me.

3 You’re my refuge, my strong tower against the enemy.

4 Let me live in your tent forever and take shelter under your wings.

5 You’ve heard my vows, God, and given me the inheritance that comes to those who respect you.

item.title: Psalms 62
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 62

1 I wait for God alone because my victory comes from him.

2 He alone is my rock, my salvation, my fortress; I won’t be shaken.

3 How long will youpl assail me so you can murder me, like a leaning wall or crumbling fence?

4 Your only intention is to knock me down; you enjoy lying about me; you bless out loud but curse inside.

5 My soul, wait in silence for God because my hope lies only in him.

item.title: Psalms 63
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 63

1 God, you’re my God; I look to you in earnest; my soul thirsts for you; my flesh yearns for you in this dry, weary land.

2 So I’ve looked at you in the sanctuary and seen your power and glory.

3 I’ll praise you because your enduring love is better than life;

4 I’ll bless you as long as I live and lift up my hands in your name.

item.title: Psalms 64
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 64

1 Listen to my complaint, God; keep me from living in dread of my enemies.

2 Hide me from the secret plots of bad people, from the schemes of sinners

3 that sharpen their tongue like a sword, that aim bitter words like arrows,

4 that shoot at innocent people from hiding places, and do it suddenly without qualms.

5 They latch onto sinful purposes and talk secretly about setting traps; they say, “Who will notice?"

item.title: Psalms 65
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 65

1 There will be silence in your presence, God, as well as praise in Zion; people will fulfill their vows to you.

2 All people will come to you, who hear prayers.

3 Sins overwhelm us, but you forgive them.

4 How blessed are the ones you choose and bring close to you to live in your courts; how satisfying is the goodness of your house, the holy Temple.

item.title: Psalms 66
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 66

1 Make a joyful sound to God, all the earth.

2 Sing about his honor; make his praise glorious.

3 Say to him, “What you do is so awesome! Your enemies feign obedience to you out of fear for your power.

4 All the earth worships you and praises you; they sing praises to you."

5 Come and see what God has done; it’s awesome what he’s done for people.

item.title: Psalms 67
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 67

1 God, be gracious and bless us; smile at us

2 so every nation can know your way and your saving power.

3 May the nations praise you; may they all praise you.

4 May they be happy and sing because you judge them justly and guide them.

5 May the nations praise you, God; may they all praise you.

6 The earth has yielded its produce; God, our God, has blessed us

item.title: Psalms 68
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 68

1 Arise, God, scatter your enemies; chase off those who hate you!

2 Blow them away like smoke; melt them like wax near fire; make sinners perish in your presence.

3 But may good people be happy, delight in your presence, celebrate and be glad.

4 So sing to God, sing praises to him; lay out a highway for the One that rides through deserts, whose name is Yahveh, and celebrate with him.

item.title: Psalms 69
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 69

1 Save me, God; I’m in water up to my neck!

2 I’ve sunk in deep mud, where there’s no foothold; a flood is sweeping over me.

3 I’m worn out from crying; my throat’s dry; my eyes are red from crying, waiting for my God.

4 The people that hate me for no reason outnumber the hairs on my head; those who want to destroy me are powerful; they’re trying to make me repay what I didn’t steal.

item.title: Psalms 70
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 70

1 Hurry and deliver me, Yahveh; come quick to help me.

2 Discredit those who want to kill me; turn them back and dishonor the people that delight in harming me.

3 Because of their disgrace, turn them back those who say, “Aha, Aha."

4 May the ones that depend on you be happy in you; may those who love your deliverance repeatedly say, “God is great."

item.title: Psalms 71
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 71

1 I’ve taken refuge in you, Yahveh; don’t let me be discredited.

2 In your goodness, rescue me; listen to me and save me.

3 Be my rock of refuge that I can always go to; give orders to save me because you’re my rock and fortress.

4 Rescue me from sinners, from the grasp of cruel men.

5 You’re my hope, Lord Yahveh, my confidence since I was young.

item.title: Psalms 72
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 72

1 Give the king your judgments, God; give your goodness to his son.

2 May he judge your people fairly, your oppressed ones with justice.

3 Let the mountains bring prosperity to the people; may the hills bring goodness.

4 May he defend the downtrodden, save the children of the needy, and crush their oppressors.

5 Let them respect you as long as the sun lasts, as long as the moon enduresâ€”throughout all generations.

item.title: Psalms 73
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 73

1 God is good to Israel, to those whose hearts are pure.

2 I’d almost stumbled; my steps almost slipped;

3 because I envied the prosperity of the arrogant.

4 They don’t seem to suffer when they die; their bodies are healthy and well.

5 They don’t have trouble like other people; they aren’t stricken like everyone else.

6 So pride is the gold chain around their neck; violence is their clothes.

item.title: Psalms 74
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 74

1 Why have you thrown us away forever, God? Why does your anger smoke at the sheep in your pasture?

2 Remember your community that you bought so long ago, that you redeemed as a tribe for your heritage, Mount Zion, where you’ve lived.

3 Direct your attention to its continuing ruins; the enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary.

4 Your adversaries have roared in your sanctuary and set up their own standards for signs.

item.title: Psalms 75
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 75

1 Thank you, God, for being close by; people declare your wonderful deeds.

2 When I set a time for judgment; I’ll judge even-handedly.

3 The earth and everybody in it melt; I’m the One that firmly set its pillars.

4 I said to people that brag, ‘Stop it,’ and to sinners, ‘Don’t lift up your horns;

5 don’t raise them up high or talk with such arrogance.’"

item.title: Psalms 76
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 76

1 God is known in Judah; his name is great in Israel.

2 His home is in Salem; he lives on Zion.

3 He has broken flaming arrows there, shields, swords, and weapons of war.

4 You’re glorious, more majestic than mountains full of beasts of prey.

5 Our stouthearted enemies have been stripped of their spoil; they’ve sunk into deep sleep; none of the soldiers could raise a hand against us.

item.title: Psalms 77
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 77

1 I raise my voice up to God; I call out loud; it rises to him so he’ll hear me.

2 When trouble comes, I turn to Yahveh for help. All night I reach out to him, but I get no reassurance.

3 When I think about him, I’m shaken; I sigh and feel faint.

4 He won’t let me sleep; I’m in such distress I can’t pray.

item.title: Psalms 78
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 78

1 Listen to my instruction, my people; pay attention to what I’m saying.

2 I’ll tell a parable and offer hidden truths from our history,

3 things we’ve heard and known from our ancestors.

4 We won’t keep them from our children; we’ll tell the next generation what we praise Yahveh for: his strength, the amazing things he’s done.

5 He established a Testimony in Jacob and appointed a Law in Israel, one that he commanded our ancestors to teach their children;

item.title: Psalms 79
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 79

1 Other nations have invaded your inheritance, God; they’ve defiled your holy Temple and laid Jerusalem in ruins.

2 They’ve given the buzzards your servants’ corpses, and the wild animals the flesh of your holy people.

3 They’ve poured out their blood like water around Jerusalem; there wasn’t anybody to bury them.

4 We’ve become a disgrace to our neighbors, mocked and derided by the people around us.

item.title: Psalms 80
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 80

1 Listen, Shepherd of Israel, you that lead Joseph like a flock; show your glory, you that are enthroned above the cherubs.

2 Stir up your power against Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh; and come to rescue us.

3 Restore us, God; look at us with favor so we’ll be saved.

4 Yahveh God of Hosts, how long will you be angry with our prayers?

5 You’ve fed us tears and made us drink them in full measure.

item.title: Psalms 81
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 81

1 Sing to God your Strength; make a joyful sound to Jacob’s God.

2 Sing, beat the tambourine, pluck the lyre and harp.

3 At the new moons blow your ram’s horn, at the full moon and on your festival days.

4 It’s a statute for Israel, an ordinance from Jacob’s God.

5 He established it as a Testimony in Joseph when he displayed his power all over Egypt. I heard a language I didn’t know, saying.

item.title: Psalms 82
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 82

1 God presides over the divine council and judges you judges.

2 So how long will youpl judge unjustly by showingpl partiality to lawbreakers?

3 Renderpl justice to the weak and fatherless; standpl up for the oppressed and destitute.

4 Rescuepl the weak and needy; deliverpl them from bad people.

5 You don’t know or understand; You’re walking around in the dark; the very foundations of your world are unstable.

item.title: Psalms 83
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 83

1 God, don’t keep quiet; don’t be silent.

2 Your enemies are making an uproar; those who hate you are exalting themselves.

3 They’re plotting against your people, conspiring against them 4and saying, “Let’s wipe out their nation so no one will remember them anymore."

5 Together they’re signing a treaty against you:

6 Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites;

7 Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia and the people in Tyre;

item.title: Psalms 84
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 84

1 Your Temple is so beautiful, Yahveh of Hosts!

2 I long, yes, even faint with longing for your courts; my body and soul sing for joy to the living God.

3 Even a sparrow finds a home for herself, a swallow builds a nest to raise her young near your altars, Yahveh of Hosts, my God and King.

4 How blessed they are who live in your Temple and continually sing your praises.

item.title: Psalms 85
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 85

1 Yahveh, you blessed your land; you restored the fortunes of Jacob;

2 you forgave your people’s iniquity and pardoned their sins;

3 you withdrew your fury and turned away from your hot anger.

4 Restore us, our Deliverer; end your displeasure with us.

5 Will you be angry with us forever? Will you extend your wrath to every generation?

6 Won’t you revive us so we can celebrate over you?

item.title: Psalms 86
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 86

1 Listen, Yahveh, and answer me because I’m troubled and in need.

2 Preserve my life because I’m a godly man; save me because I trust in you.

3 Be gracious to me because I call out to you all the time.

4 Make me happy because I hold up my life to you.

5 You’re good, ready to forgive, and abundant in enduring love to everyone that calls on you.

item.title: Psalms 87
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 87

1 The city that Yahveh founded stands on his holy mountain;

2 he loves Zion more than the other places in Jacob.

3 Glorious things are said about you, city of God.

4 I’ll count Rahab [Egypt] and Babylon among those who know me, Philistia, Tyre, and Nubia too: ‘They’ve become citizens there,’" people will say.

5 But they will say about Zion, “This one and that one were born here”; the Most High himself has made it so.

item.title: Psalms 88
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 88

1 Yahveh God who keeps me safe, I call out to you day and night.

2 Let my prayer come to you; listen to my call!

3 I’ve had so much trouble; I’m close to Sheol.

4 I’m as good as dead, like someone with no strength left.

5 Abandoned among the dead like someone slain in the grave, I’m forgotten and cut off from you.

6 You’ve put me in the Pit, in regions dark and deep.

item.title: Psalms 89
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 89

1 I’ll sing forever about Yahveh’s enduring love and make known his faithfulness to every generation,

2 because I’ve said, “You build up enduring love; in the heavens you establish your faithfulness."

3 Yahveh said, “I’ve made a covenant with my chosen one; I’ve sworn to David my servant,

4 I’ll make your descendants secure forever and build up your throne to all generations.’"

5 The sky praises your wonders and extols your faithfulness in the assembly of your holy angels.

item.title: Psalms 90
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 90

1 Yahveh, through all generations you’ve been our dwelling place.

2 Before the mountains were born or you gave birth to the world, from one end of time to the other, you’ve been God.

3 You turn people back to dust and say, “Return to dust, mortals."

4 A thousand years to you are like yesterday, like a watch in the night.

5 You sweep us away like the dreams in our sleep. In the morning we sprout like grass 6and flourish; then toward evening we fade like blossoms and wither away.

item.title: Psalms 91
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 91

1 Those who live in the shelter of the Most High will find rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

2 They’ll say about Yahveh, “Our refuge and fortress, the God we trust!"

3 He delivers you from the trapper’s snare and deadly pestilence.

4 He covers you with his pinions; you can find refuge under his wings; his faithfulness shields and protects you.

5 You won’t be afraid of terrors at night, of arrows that fly by day,

item.title: Psalms 92
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 92

1 It’s good to thank you, Yahveh, to sing praises to you, Most High;

2 to declare your enduring love in the morning and your faithfulness at night

3 with a lute and a ten-stringed harp, with melody on a lyre.

4 Because you’ve made me happy by what you’ve done, I’ll sing for joy over what you do.

5 Your deeds are so great, Yahveh, your thoughts so deep!

item.title: Psalms 93
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 93

1 Yahveh reigns, robed in majesty, dressed in strength. The world stands firm; it won’t move.

2 Your throne has been secure from of old; you’re from eternity past.

3 The floods have swelled; the roar of their pounding waves has increased.

4 But more than the thunder of overwhelming water, more than the mighty ocean breakers against the shore, Yahveh on high, you are powerful.

5 Your decrees stand firm; holiness adorns your Temple forever.

item.title: Psalms 94
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 94

1 Yahveh God of vengeance, shine!

2 Rise up, Judge of the whole world; repay the proud.

3 How long will you let sinners celebrate?

4 How long will they pour out their arrogant words, vaunt themselves up

5 crush your people, attack your heritage

6 murder widows and foreigners and orphans,

7 and say, “Yahveh’s not watching; Jacob’s God is not paying attention."

8 You silly people, you pay attention; when will you ever understand?

item.title: Psalms 95
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 95

1 Come, let’s sing to Yahveh; let’s make a joyful sound to the Rock that saves us.

2 Let’s go to him with thanksgiving and sing to him with psalms.

3 Yahveh is a great God, a great King above all gods.

4 He controls the deep sea; he owns the mountain peaks

5 and the ocean because he created them; he made the dry land.

6 Come, let’s bow in worship; let’s kneel to Yahveh our Maker.

item.title: Psalms 96
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 96

1 Sing a new song to Yahveh; sing to him, all the earth.

2 Bless him in song; proclaim every day the good news that he saves.

3 Tell about his glory the world over, his marvelous deeds among the nations.

4 Yahveh is great and deserves great praise; he’s to be respected more than all gods

5 because the nations’ gods are idols, but Yahveh created the sky.

item.title: Psalms 97
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 97

1 Yahveh reigns; let the world rejoice; let the distant shores be glad.

2 Clouds and dense darkness surround him; goodness and justice are the foundation for his throne.

3 Fire goes forth ahead of him and burns up his adversaries.

4 His lightning lights up the world; the world sees it and trembles.

5 The mountains melt like wax at hisY presence everywhere.

6 The sky declares his goodness; every nation can see his glory.

item.title: Psalms 98
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 98

1 Sing a new song to Yahveh because he’s done outstanding things; his right hand and holy arm have given him victory.

2 He has made his salvation known and revealed his goodness to the nations.

3 He has remembered his enduring love and faithfulness to Israel; people the earth over have seen the deliverance our God gives.

4 Make a joyful sound to Yahveh, all the earth; break out in joyful song.

item.title: Psalms 99
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 99

1 Yahveh reigns; let the people tremble; he sits on his throne above the cherubs; let the earth quake!

2 Yahveh is great in Zion; he’s exalted above all nations.

3 Let them praise his great, awesome name; he is holy.

4 The great King who loves justice has established what’s fair for all.

5 Exalt Yahveh our God and worship at his feet; he is holy.

item.title: Psalms 100
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 100

1 Make a joyful sound to Yahveh, all the earth.

2 Serve him gladly; come to him with singing.

3 Acknowledge that Yahveh is God; he made us; we didn’t make ourselves. We’re his people, sheep in his pasture.

4 Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise. Thank him and bless him 5because he’s good; his enduring love never ends; his faithfulness extends to every generation.

item.title: Psalms 101
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 101

1 I’ll sing about your enduring love and justice, and sing praises to you, Yahveh.

2 I’ll pay attention to the way that’s blameless; when will you come to help me? In my home I’ll walk in integrity.

3 I won’t set anything base beside me; I’ll hate what they do who fall away; I’ll stay away from them.

4 I’ll cast perverse things out of my heart and have nothing to do with evil.

item.title: Psalms 102
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 102

1 Listen to my prayer, Yahveh! Let my cry come to you.

2 Don’t turn away from me in my distress; when I call, answer quickly.

3 My days dissipate like smoke; my bones lie scorched on a hearth.

4 My heart is weak and withers away like grass; I have no appetite 5in my loud groaning; I’m skin and bones.

6 I’m like a pelican in the desert, like an owl in desolate places;

item.title: Psalms 103
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 103

1 Bless Yahveh, all that I am! Everything that’s in me, bless him.

2 Bless Yahveh, all that I am; May I never forget how he helps me:

3 he pardons my sins and heals my diseases;

4 he rescues me from the Pit and crowns me with enduring love and mercy;

5 he satisfies my years with good things, and renews my youth like an eagle’s.

item.title: Psalms 104
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 104

1 Bless Yahveh, everything that I am! Yahveh my God, you’re so great; you’re dressed in splendor and majesty.

2 You cover yourself with light as with a robe; you’ve stretched out the sky like a tent.

3 You laid the beams for your rooms on the water; you make the clouds your chariot and walk on the wind.

4 You make the winds your messengers and blazing fire your ministers.

item.title: Psalms 105
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 105

1 Be grateful to Yahveh; call on him; tell the nations what all he’s done.

2 Sing praises to him; talk about the amazing acts.

3 Take pride in his holy name; let the people be happy that rely on him.

4 Rely on Yahveh and his strength; depend on him always.

5 Remember his amazing miracles, the judgments he’s rendered,

6 descendants of Abraham his servant, children of Jacob, his chosen ones!

item.title: Psalms 106
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 106

1 Hallelujah! Be grateful to Yahveh because he’s good; his enduring love lasts forever.

2 Who can recount all his mighty deeds? Who can ever praise him enough?

3 How blessed they are who maintain justice, who practice goodness all the time!

4 Remember me, Yahveh, when you’re gracious to your people; come and rescue me

5 so I can share in your holy people’s prosperity, celebrate in your nation’s happiness, and glory in your heritage.

item.title: Psalms 107
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 107

1 Be grateful to Yahveh because he’s good; his love endures forever.

2 Let his redeemed say it, the ones he rescued from their adversaries

3 and gathered from other countries east and west, north and south.

4 Some wandered in trackless desert and couldn’t find their way to any inhabited city.

5 Hungry and thirsty, their souls fainted inside them.

6 Then they appealed to Yahveh in their trouble, and he delivered them from it;

item.title: Psalms 108
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 108

1 I’m steadfast, God; I’ll sing praises in my heart.

2 Wake up, harp and lyre; I’ll wake up at dawn!

3 I’ll thank you, Yahveh, among the nations and sing praises to you everywhere,

4 because your enduring love is bigger than the sky; your truth is as high as the heavens.

5 Be lifted up, God, above the sky; display your glory the world over.

item.title: Psalms 109
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 109

1 God that I praise, speak up for me!

2 Deceitful people speak against me; they slander me with lies.

3 They surround me with hateful words and fight me for no reason.

4 In return for my love, they accuse me even when I’m praying for them.

5 They repay me evil for good, hatred for love.

6 Appoint someone corrupt over them, an accuser to stand beside them.

item.title: Psalms 110
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 110

1 Yahveh said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand till I make your enemies your footstool."

2 Yahveh will extend your mighty scepter from on Zion, and say, “Rule your enemies."

3 Your soldiers will volunteer readily when you muster your army in holy array; your strength will be renewed every morning like the dew.

4 Yahveh has sworn and won’t change his mind, “You’re a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek."

item.title: Psalms 111
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 111

1 Hallelujah! I thank Yahveh with all my heart in the presence of his godly people.

2 His works are so outstanding no one that delights in them can quit thinking about them;

3 their splendor and majesty reflect his eternal goodness;

4 he makes his amazing acts memorable because they show his grace and mercy.

5 He feeds those who respect him and remembers his covenant with them;

item.title: Psalms 112
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 112

1 Hallelujah! How blessed people are that respect Yahveh and delight in what he calls on them to do.

2 Their descendants will be successful and a blessing to their own generation.

3 They’ll have wealth and riches in their homes, and their goodness will last forever.

4 Godly people have light in the dark; they’re gracious, merciful, and good.

5 Goodness comes to those who graciously lend and conduct their affairs with justice.

item.title: Psalms 113
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 113

1 Hallelujah! Servants of Yahveh, praise him;

2 bless him from now on forever;

3 from sunrise to sunset, praise him.

4 On high above the nations, he displays his glory in the sky.

5 Who is like Yahveh our God that sits on high, 6but humbles himself to watch what’s happening in the sky and on earth?

7 Then he raises up the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash pile

item.title: Psalms 114
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 114

1 When Israel left Egyptâ€” when the House of Jacob came out from a nation with a different languageâ€”

2 the land of Judah became his sanctuary; Israel became his kingdom.

3 The Red Sea saw them coming and backed away; the Jordan quit flowing.

4 The mountains jumped like rams; the hills skipped around like lambs.

5 What’s the matter with you, Sea, that you’re backing away, or Jordan, that you’ve quit flowing,

item.title: Psalms 115
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 115

1 Not to us, Yahveh, not to us, but to you be honor because of your enduring love and faithfulness.

2 Why should the nations say, “Where’s their God?"

3 Our God is in heaven, where he accomplishes what he intends.

4 Their man-made idols are just silver and gold

5 with mouths that can’t talk, eyes that can’t see,

6 ears that can’t hear, noses that can’t smell,

item.title: Psalms 116
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 116

1 I love Yahveh because he listens to my petitions;

2 so I’ll call on him as long as I live.

3 The snares of death were all around me; the pains of Sheol came on me; I suffered distress and sorrow.

4 Then I called on Yahveh, “Please save me."

5 YouY are gracious and good, merciful God.

6 You preserve the simple; when I was brought low, you saved me.

item.title: Psalms 117
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 117

1 Praise Yahveh, every nation; praise him, every people group,

2 because he has great enduring love toward us. HisY faithfulness lasts forever. Hallelujah!

item.title: Psalms 118
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 118

1 Be grateful to Yahveh because he’s good; his love lasts forever.

2 Let Israel say, “His love lasts forever."

3 Let the house of Aaron house say, “His love lasts forever."

4 Let those that respect Yahveh say, “His love lasts forever."

5 I called on Yahveh in my distress; he answered me and set me free.

6 HeY is on my side; so I won’t be afraid; what can mortals do to me?

item.title: Psalms 119
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 119

1 How blessed they are who follow his way blamelessly, who follow the Law of Yahveh,

2 who observe his testimonies and look to him with all their heart.

3 They do no evil who follow his ways.

4 You’ve charged us to keep your commandments diligently.

5 Oh that my ways may become secure by reflecting on your statutes!

6 I won’t be disgraced if I keep my eye on everything you’ve commanded.

item.title: Psalms 120
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 120

1 In my troubles I appealed to Yahveh, and he answered me.

2 Yahveh, rescue me from lying lips and treacherous tongues.

3 What will God do to you, treacherous tongues? How will he intensify your punishment?

4 He’ll pierce you with a soldier’s sharp arrows and burn you with coals from a broom tree.

5 Misfortune awaits me because I’m a foreigner in Meshech, because I live among the tents of Kedar!

item.title: Psalms 121
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 121

1 I look up toward the mountainsâ€” will my help come from there?

2 It’ll come from Yahveh, who made earth and sky.

3 He won’t let your foot slip. The One that guards you won’t slumber;

4 he who watches over Israel never sleeps.

5 Yahveh is your keeper; he’s your protection nearby.

6 The sun won’t harm you during the day or the moon at night.

item.title: Psalms 122
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 122

1 It made me happy when they said, “Let’s go to Yahveh’s Temple."

2 We’re standing inside your gates, Jerusalem,

3 that’s built solid and seamless,

4 where the tribes of Yahveh go up as required by the Law to give him thanks;

5 the thrones for judgment stand here, the thrones of David’s dynasty.

6 Pray for peace in Jerusalem: “May they prosper who love you;

item.title: Psalms 123
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 123

1 I look to you enthroned in heaven!

2 Like a servant looks to his master and a maid looks to her mistress, we look to Yahveh our God, to show us mercy.

3 Be gracious to us, Yahveh, because we’re had our fill of contempt.

4 For too long our lives have been full of the scorn of people at ease and the contempt of arrogant others.

item.title: Psalms 124
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 124

1 Let Israel acknowledge, “If Yahveh hadn’t taken our side

2 when people attacked us,

3 they would have swallowed us alive in their fury,

4 the water would have overwhelmed us, the river would have rushed over us

5 the raging water would’ve drowned us."

6 Bless Yahveh, who didn’t let us be torn to pieces in their teeth.

7 We escaped like a bird from a trapper’s snare; the snare broke and we got away.

item.title: Psalms 125
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 125

1 Those who trust in Yahveh are like Mount Zion, that can’t be moved, that lasts forever.

2 Like mountains surround Jerusalem, Yahveh surrounds his people from now on forever.

3 Sinners won’t rule in the land allotted to good people because they’d tempt the good to do wrong.

4 Yahveh does good to those who do good, who are godly in heart.

5 But those who turn aside to their crooked ways, he’ll lead away with sinners. Peace to Israel!

item.title: Psalms 126
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 126

1 When Yahveh brought us exiles back to Zion, we were like people dreaming.

2 Our mouths were laughing, our tongues were shouting with joy; the other nations were saying of us, “Yahveh has done great things for them."

3 Yes, Yahveh has done great things for us; we’re happy.

4 Restore our fortunes, Yahveh, like streams in the Negev.

5 Those who sow in tears will reap with joy.

item.title: Psalms 127
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 127

1 Unless Yahveh builds the house, they work for nothing who build it; unless Yahveh guards the city, its watchmen stay awake for no reason.

2 In vain you rise early and work late to eat the food you gain by painful labor; he gives rest to the ones he loves.

3 Children are a gift from Yahveh; what the womb produces is a reward.

4 Children born to a young man are like arrows in a soldier’s hand.

item.title: Psalms 128
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 128

1 How blessed you are that respect Yahveh and follow his ways.

2 When you eat what you earn, you’ll be happy, and life will be good.

3 Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in your house; your children will be like olive plants around your table.

4 That’s how you’re blessed who respect Yahveh.

5 Yahveh bless you from Zion; may you see Jerusalem prosper all your whole life.

item.title: Psalms 129
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 129

1 Let Israel say,

2 They’ve persecuted me often since I was young, but they haven’t defeated me.

3 My back looks like a farmer plowed it and made long furrows."

4 Yahveh is good; he has cut loose from me the cords of the wicked.

5 May everyone that hates Zion be driven away and discredited.

6 Let them be like grass on a rooftop that withers before it’s grown.

item.title: Psalms 130
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 130

1 Yahveh, I’ve cried out to you from the depths;

2 be attentive to my petitions.

3 If you kept track of sins, who could stand?

4 But you forgive so people can continue to respect you.

5 I wait for Yahveh and put my hope in what he says.

6 I wait for the Lord more than watchmen hope for morning.

7 Israel, put your hope in Yahveh because there’s enduring love and abundant redemption in him.

item.title: Psalms 131
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 131

1 Yahveh, my heart’s not proud or my eyes arrogant; I don’t insert myself into things I can’t handle.

2 I’ve calmed and quieted myself; like a weaned child resting against its mother, my soul is quiet within me.

3 Israel, put your hope in Yahveh from now on forever.

item.title: Psalms 132
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 132

1 Yahveh, remember David and what he suffered;

2 how he swore to Yahveh and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

3 I won’t go to my own house or get on my bed 4and sleep

5 till I find a place for Yahveh to live, a place for the Mighty One of Jacob."

6 We heard it in Ephrathah and found it in the fields of Jaar,

item.title: Psalms 133
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 133

1 It’s so good and pleasant for brothers to live together in peace.

2 It’s like precious anointing oil running down like it did on Aaron’s beard and dripped on his robe.

3 It’s like the dew from Mount Hermon that falls on the hills around Mount Zion; Yahveh commanded the blessing thereâ€”eternal life.

item.title: Psalms 134
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 134

1 Bless Yahveh, you servants of Yahveh that serve at night in his Temple!

2 Raise your hands toward the sanctuary and bless him.

3 May the One that made earth and sky bless you from Zion.

item.title: Psalms 135
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 135

1 Hallelujah! Praise Yahveh; praise him, his servant,

2 you that stand in his Temple, in the courts of our God!

3 Praise him because he’s good; sing his praises because he’s gracious,

4 because he’s chosen Jacob for himself, Israel for his own possession.

5 I know Yahveh is great, that he’s above all gods.

6 He does what he wants in the sky, on earth, in the seas and all their depths.

item.title: Psalms 136
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 136

1 Give thanks to Yahveh because he’s good. His love is everlasting.

2 Give thanks to the God of gods. His love is everlasting.

3 Give thanks to the Lord of lords, His love is everlasting.

4 to him alone that does great things, His love is everlasting.

5 to him that made the sky in his wisdom, His love is everlasting.

6 to him that spread out the dry land higher than the water, His love is everlasting.

item.title: Psalms 137
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 137

1 We sat by the rivers in Babylon and cried when we remembered Zion.

2 We hung our harps on its willows.

3 Our captors required us to sing there; our tormentors demanded happy songs, “Sing us a song from Zion."

4 How can we sing about Yahveh in a foreign land?

5 If I forget you, Jerusalem, may my right hand wither.

6 May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you, if I don’t regard Jerusalem above my greatest joy.

item.title: Psalms 138
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 138

1 I thank you with all my heart and sing your praises in front of the mighty.

2 I bow toward your holy Temple and thank you for your enduring love and faithfulness, because you’ve guaranteed your promises with the honor your name has.

3 You answered me when I called out to you and made me bold with strength.

4 Kings will thank you, Yahveh, when they hear what you say.

item.title: Psalms 139
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 139

1 Yahveh, you’ve known me and examined me.

2 You know when I sit down and when I get up; from a long way off you know what I’m thinking.

3 You search out my traveling and my resting; you’re well acquainted with my ways.

4 Before I speak, you know what I’m going to say.

5 You’ve protected me front and back and laid your hand over me.

item.title: Psalms 140
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 140

1 Yahveh, rescue me from sinful people protect me from those who are violent,

2 that plot evil things in their minds, and constantly stir up conflict.

3 They have pointed tongues like a snake; viper’s venom lies behind their lips.

4 Yahveh, protect me from sinful people; Protect me from those who are violent, that try to trip me.

5 The arrogant hide traps for me; with cords they spread a net beside the road and set snares for me.

item.title: Psalms 141
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 141

1 Yahveh, I’m calling on you; come quick; hear me out.

2 Consider my prayer as incense and the raising of my hands as an evening offering.

3 Guard my mouth; watch over my lips.

4 Incline my heart away from anything evil, from practicing sinful things with sinners.

5 Let a godly person strike me or rebuke me graciously; that would be ointment for my head; Don’t let me refuse it. I still pray constantly against the deeds of sinners.

item.title: Psalms 142
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 142

1 I cry out to Yahveh and petition him;

2 I pour out my complaint to him and tell him my troubles.

3 When I feel overwhelmed, he knows the route I should take; they’ve hidden traps for me on every path I walk.

4 I look in every direction, but nobody notices me. There’s no escape for me; nobody cares if I live.

5 I’m calling out to you, Yahveh; “You’re my refuge, my portion among the living.

item.title: Psalms 143
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 143

1 Hear my prayer, Yahveh; listen to my petition; in your faithfulness and goodness, come to my relief.

2 Don’t put me on trial because, compared to you, nobody’s good.

3 My enemy has chased me, crushed me on the ground, and made me sit in the dark like people long dead.

4 So I feel overwhelmed, and my heart is empty.

5 I remember the old days; I ponder everything you’ve done and think about what you’ve made.

item.title: Psalms 144
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 144

1 Bless Yahveh, my Rock, who trains my hands for war, my fingers for battle.

2 He’s my enduring love and fortress, my stronghold and deliverer, my shield and refuge, who subdues nations.

3 Yahveh, what are we that you give us any thought or care about us?

4 We’re like a breath; our lifetime is like a passing shadow.

5 Lower the sky, Yahveh, and come down; touch the mountains and make them smoke.

item.title: Psalms 145
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 145

1 I’ll praise you highly, my God and king, and bless you forever.

2 I’ll bless you every day and praise you from now on.

3 You’re great and deserve great praise; you have a greatness we have no way to measure.

4 One generation will praise your works to the next and tell about the powerful things you’ve done.

5 They’ll think about your majestic glory and splendor and about your amazing acts.

item.title: Psalms 146
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 146

1 Praise Yahveh, my soul!

2 I’ll praise my God as long as I live and sing praises to him as long as I’m here.

3 Don’t rely on rulers, mortals, who can’t help.

4 They quit breathing and go back into the ground; their plans come to an end at the same time.

5 How blessed they are that have Jacob’s God to help them, whose hope lies in Yahveh

item.title: Psalms 147
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 147

1 Hallelujah! It’s good to sing praises to our God; praising him is fitting because he’s gracious.

2 Yahveh builds up Jerusalem and gathers the outcasts in Israel.

3 He heals the brokenhearted and bandages up their wounds.

4 He counts the stars and calls them each by name.

5 Our Lord is great and has great power, and understanding without limit.

6 He supports the abused and takes sinners down to the ground.

item.title: Psalms 148
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 148

1 Hallelujah! Praise Yahveh from heaven; praise him in the sky.

2 Praise him, all his hosts of angels.

3 Praise him, sun and moon and shining stars.

4 Praise him, highest heaven, and water vapor in the sky.

5 Let them praise Yahveh because he commanded and they came to be.

6 He established them forever by a decree that won’t expire.

7 Praise Yahveh from earth, you sea monsters and all the great deep,

item.title: Psalms 149
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 149

1 Hallelujah! Sing Yahveh a new song; praise him in the assembly of his holy people.

2 Be happy in your Maker, Israel; celebrate your King, people of Zion.

3 Praise him with dancing; sing praises with tambourines and lyres,

4 because Yahveh delights in you and graces harassed people with deliverance.

5 Holy people, celebrate in glory; sing for joy on your couches.

6 Have the high praises of God in your voices and two-edged swords in your hands

item.title: Psalms 150
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 150

1 Hallelujah! Praise God in his sanctuary; praise him in his heavenly expanse.

2 Praise him for his powerful deeds in proportion to his greatness.

3 Praise him with trumpet, harp, and lyre.

4 Praise him with tambourines and dancing,

5 Praise him with cymbals, with loud crashing cymbals.

6 Everything that breathes, praise Yahveh. Hallelujah!
